word: "WHEREAS IN VIEW OF THE SEPARATION WHICH WE  BELIEVE SHOULD EXIST BETWEEN THE CHURCH AND THE STATE, IT IS INCONSISTENT FOR THE CHURCH TO RECEIVE FROM THE STATE PECUNIARY GIFTS, FAVORS, EXEMPTIONS, ON RELIGIOUS GROUNDS; THEREFORE RESOLVED THAT WE REPUDIATE THE DOCTRINE THAT CHURCH OR OTHER ECCLESIASTICAL PROPERTIES SHOULD BE EXEMPT FROM TAXATION AND FURTHER, RESOLVED, THAT WE USE OUR INFLUENCE IN SECURING THE REPEAL OF SUCH LEGISLATION AS GRANTS AND EXEMPTIONS."--GENERAL CONFERENCE BULLETIN, MARCH 5, 1893, P. 475.
